trans-unit.source: The ISEOptions Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEOptions Object

trans-unit.source: The ISEOptions Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEOptions Object

trans-unit.source: The **ISEOptions** object represents various settings for Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The **ISEOptions** object represents various settings for Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEOptions** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **Microsoft.PowerShell.Host.ISE.ISEOptions** class.

trans-unit.source: The **ISEOptions** object provides the following methods and properties.
trans-unit.target: The **ISEOptions** object provides the following methods and properties.

trans-unit.source: Methods
trans-unit.target: Methods

trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultConsoleTokenColors()

trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaults()

trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultTokenColors()

trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultXmlTokenColors()

trans-unit.source: RestoreDefaultConsoleTokenColors
trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultConsoleTokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Restores the default values of the token colors in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Restores the default values of the token colors in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: RestoreDefaults
trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaults

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Restores the default values of all options settings in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Restores the default values of all options settings in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It also resets the behavior of various warning messages that provide the standard check box to prevent the message from being shown again.
trans-unit.target: It also resets the behavior of various warning messages that provide the standard check box to prevent the message from being shown again.

trans-unit.source: RestoreDefaultTokenColors
trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultTokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Restores the default values of the token colors in the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Restores the default values of the token colors in the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: RestoreDefaultXmlTokenColors
trans-unit.target: RestoreDefaultXmlTokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Restores the default values of the token colors for XML elements that are displayed in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Restores the default values of the token colors for XML elements that are displayed in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Also see [XmlTokenColors](#xtc).
trans-unit.target: Also see [XmlTokenColors](#xtc).

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: AutoSaveMinuteInterval
trans-unit.target: AutoSaveMinuteInterval

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic save operations of your files by Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic save operations of your files by Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 2 minutes.

trans-unit.source: The value is an integer.
trans-unit.target: The value is an integer.

trans-unit.source: CommandPaneBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: CommandPaneBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneBackgroundColor](#conpbc).
trans-unit.target: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneBackgroundColor](#conpbc).

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for the Command pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for the Command pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: CommandPaneUp
trans-unit.target: CommandPaneUp

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Command pane is located above the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Command pane is located above the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: ConsolePaneBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: ConsolePaneBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: ConsolePaneForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: ConsolePaneForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the foreground color of the text in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the foreground color of the text in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: ConsolePaneTextBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: ConsolePaneTextBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color of the text in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color of the text in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: ConsoleTokenColors
trans-unit.target: ConsoleTokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Windows PowerShell ISE Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Windows PowerShell ISE Console pane.

trans-unit.source: This property is a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: This property is a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: To change the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Script pane, see [TokenColors](#tc).
trans-unit.target: To change the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Script pane, see [TokenColors](#tc).

trans-unit.source: To reset the colors to the default values, see [RestoreDefaultConsoleTokenColors()](#rdctc).
trans-unit.target: To reset the colors to the default values, see [RestoreDefaultConsoleTokenColors()](#rdctc).

trans-unit.source: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.
trans-unit.target: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.

trans-unit.source: DebugBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: DebugBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for the debug text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for the debug text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: DebugForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: DebugForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the foreground color for the debug text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the foreground color for the debug text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: DefaultOptions
trans-unit.target: DefaultOptions

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: A collection of properties that specify the default values to be used when the Reset methods are used.
trans-unit.target: A collection of properties that specify the default values to be used when the Reset methods are used.

trans-unit.source: ErrorBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: ErrorBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for error text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for error text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: ErrorForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: ErrorForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the foreground color for error text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the foreground color for error text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: FontName
trans-unit.target: FontName

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the font name currently in use in both the Script pane and the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the font name currently in use in both the Script pane and the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: FontSize
trans-unit.target: FontSize

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the font size as an integer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the font size as an integer.

trans-unit.source: It is used in the Script pane, the Command pane, and the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: It is used in the Script pane, the Command pane, and the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: The valid range of values is 8 through 32.
trans-unit.target: The valid range of values is 8 through 32.

trans-unit.source: IntellisenseTimeoutInSeconds
trans-unit.target: IntellisenseTimeoutInSeconds

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of seconds that IntelliSense uses to try to resolve the currently typed text.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of seconds that IntelliSense uses to try to resolve the currently typed text.

trans-unit.source: After this number of seconds, IntelliSense times out and enables you to continue typing.
trans-unit.target: After this number of seconds, IntelliSense times out and enables you to continue typing.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 3 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 3 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The value is an integer.
trans-unit.target: The value is an integer.

trans-unit.source: MruCount
trans-unit.target: MruCount

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of recently opened files that Windows PowerShell ISE tracks and displays at the bottom of the **File Open** menu.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of recently opened files that Windows PowerShell ISE tracks and displays at the bottom of the **File Open** menu.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 10.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 10.

trans-unit.source: The value is an integer.
trans-unit.target: The value is an integer.

trans-unit.source: OutputPaneBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: OutputPaneBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneBackgroundColor](#conpbc).
trans-unit.target: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneBackgroundColor](#conpbc).

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that gets or sets the background color for the Output pane itself.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that gets or sets the background color for the Output pane itself.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: OutputPaneTextForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: OutputPaneTextForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneForegroundColor](#conpfc).
trans-unit.target: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneForegroundColor](#conpfc).

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that changes the foreground color of the text in the Output pane in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that changes the foreground color of the text in the Output pane in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0.

trans-unit.source: OutputPaneTextBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: OutputPaneTextBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.
trans-unit.target: This feature is present in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, but was removed or renamed in later versions of the ISE.

trans-unit.source: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneTextBackgroundColor](#conptbc).
trans-unit.target: For later versions, see [ConsolePaneTextBackgroundColor](#conptbc).

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that changes the background color of the text in the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that changes the background color of the text in the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: ScriptPaneBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: ScriptPaneBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that gets or sets the background color for files.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that gets or sets the background color for files.

trans-unit.source: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.
trans-unit.target: It is an instance of the **System.Windows.Media.Color** class.

trans-unit.source: ScriptPaneForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: ScriptPaneForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that gets or sets the foreground color for non\-script files in the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that gets or sets the foreground color for non\-script files in the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: To set the foreground color for script files, use the [TokenColors](The-ISEOptions-Object.md#tc) property.
trans-unit.target: To set the foreground color for script files, use the [TokenColors](The-ISEOptions-Object.md#tc) property.

trans-unit.source: SelectedScriptPaneState
trans-unit.target: SelectedScriptPaneState

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: The read\/write property that gets or sets the position of the Script pane on the display.
trans-unit.target: The read\/write property that gets or sets the position of the Script pane on the display.

trans-unit.source: The string can be either "Maximized", "Top", or "Right".
trans-unit.target: The string can be either "Maximized", "Top", or "Right".

trans-unit.source: ShowDefaultSnippets
trans-unit.target: ShowDefaultSnippets

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the **CTRL\+J** list of snippets includes the starter set that is included in Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the **CTRL\+J** list of snippets includes the starter set that is included in Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: When set to **$false**, only user\-defined snippets appear in the **CTRL\+J** list.
trans-unit.target: When set to **$false**, only user\-defined snippets appear in the **CTRL\+J** list.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowIntellisenseInConsolePane
trans-unit.target: ShowIntellisenseInConsolePane

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether IntelliSense offers syntax, parameter, and value suggestions in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether IntelliSense offers syntax, parameter, and value suggestions in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowIntellisenseInScriptPane
trans-unit.target: ShowIntellisenseInScriptPane

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether IntelliSense offers syntax, parameter, and value suggestions in the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether IntelliSense offers syntax, parameter, and value suggestions in the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowLineNumbers
trans-unit.target: ShowLineNumbers

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Script pane displays line numbers in the left margin.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Script pane displays line numbers in the left margin.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowOutlining
trans-unit.target: ShowOutlining

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Script pane displays expandable and collapsible brackets next to sections of code in the left margin.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Script pane displays expandable and collapsible brackets next to sections of code in the left margin.

trans-unit.source: When they are displayed, you can click the minus \(\-\) icons next to a block of text to collapse it or click the plus \(\+\) icon to expand a block of text.
trans-unit.target: When they are displayed, you can click the minus \(\-\) icons next to a block of text to collapse it or click the plus \(\+\) icon to expand a block of text.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowToolBar
trans-unit.target: ShowToolBar

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the ISE toolbar appears at the top of the Windows PowerShell ISE window.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the ISE toolbar appears at the top of the Windows PowerShell ISE window.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowWarningBeforeSavingOnRun
trans-unit.target: ShowWarningBeforeSavingOnRun

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether a warning message appears when a script is saved automatically before it is run.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether a warning message appears when a script is saved automatically before it is run.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: ShowWarningForDuplicateFiles
trans-unit.target: ShowWarningForDuplicateFiles

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether a warning message appears when the same file is opened in different PowerShell tabs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether a warning message appears when the same file is opened in different PowerShell tabs.

trans-unit.source: If set to **$true**, to open the same file in multiple tabs displays this message: "A copy of this file is open in another Windows PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: If set to **$true**, to open the same file in multiple tabs displays this message: "A copy of this file is open in another Windows PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to this file will affect all open copies."
trans-unit.target: Changes made to this file will affect all open copies."

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: TokenColors
trans-unit.target: TokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Windows PowerShell ISE Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Windows PowerShell ISE Script pane.

trans-unit.source: This property is a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: This property is a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: To change the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Console pane, see [ConsoleTokenColors](#contc).
trans-unit.target: To change the colors of the IntelliSense tokens in the Console pane, see [ConsoleTokenColors](#contc).

trans-unit.source: To reset the colors to the default values, see [RestoreDefaultTokenColors()](#rdtc).
trans-unit.target: To reset the colors to the default values, see [RestoreDefaultTokenColors()](#rdtc).

trans-unit.source: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.
trans-unit.target: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.

trans-unit.source: UseEnterToSelectInConsolePaneIntellisense
trans-unit.target: UseEnterToSelectInConsolePaneIntellisense

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether you can use the Enter key to select an IntelliSense provided option in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether you can use the Enter key to select an IntelliSense provided option in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: UseEnterToSelectInScriptPaneIntellisense
trans-unit.target: UseEnterToSelectInScriptPaneIntellisense

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether you can use the Enter key to select an IntelliSense\-provided option in the Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether you can use the Enter key to select an IntelliSense\-provided option in the Script pane.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **$true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **$true**.

trans-unit.source: UseLocalHelp
trans-unit.target: UseLocalHelp

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the locally installed Help or the online TechNet Library Help appears when you press F1 with the cursor positioned in a keyword.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the locally installed Help or the online TechNet Library Help appears when you press F1 with the cursor positioned in a keyword.

trans-unit.source: If set to **$true**, then a pop\-up window shows content from the locally installed Help.
trans-unit.target: If set to **$true**, then a pop\-up window shows content from the locally installed Help.

trans-unit.source: You can install the Help files by running the `Update-Help` command.
trans-unit.target: You can install the Help files by running the `Update-Help` command.

trans-unit.source: If set to **$false**, then your browser opens to a page in the TechNet Library.
trans-unit.target: If set to **$false**, then your browser opens to a page in the TechNet Library.

trans-unit.source: VerboseBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: VerboseBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for verbose text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for verbose text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.
trans-unit.target: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.

trans-unit.source: VerboseForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: VerboseForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the foreground color for verbose text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the foreground color for verbose text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.
trans-unit.target: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.

trans-unit.source: WarningBackgroundColor
trans-unit.target: WarningBackgroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the background color for warning text that appears in the Console pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the background color for warning text that appears in the Console pane.

trans-unit.source: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.
trans-unit.target: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.

trans-unit.source: WarningForegroundColor
trans-unit.target: WarningForegroundColor

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the foreground color for warning text that appears in the Output pane.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the foreground color for warning text that appears in the Output pane.

trans-unit.source: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.
trans-unit.target: It is a **System.Windows.Media.Color** object.

trans-unit.source: XmlTokenColors
trans-unit.target: XmlTokenColors

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for XML content that is displayed in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a dictionary object that contains name\/value pairs of token types and colors for XML content that is displayed in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.
trans-unit.target: Token colors can be set for the following: Attribute, Command, CommandArgument, CommandParameter, Comment, GroupEnd, GroupStart, Keyword, LineContinuation, LoopLabel, Member, NewLine, Number, Operator, Position, StatementSeparator, String, Type, Unknown, Variable.

trans-unit.source: Also see [RestoreDefaultXmlTokenColors()](#rdxtc).
trans-unit.target: Also see [RestoreDefaultXmlTokenColors()](#rdxtc).

trans-unit.source: Zoom
trans-unit.target: Zoom

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the relative size of text in both the Console and Script panes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the relative size of text in both the Console and Script panes.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 100.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 100.

trans-unit.source: Smaller values cause the text in Windows PowerShell ISE to appear smaller while larger numbers cause text to appear larger.
trans-unit.target: Smaller values cause the text in Windows PowerShell ISE to appear smaller while larger numbers cause text to appear larger.

trans-unit.source: The value is an integer that ranges from 20 to 400.
trans-unit.target: The value is an integer that ranges from 20 to 400.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: [The Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](The-Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Scripting-Object-Model.md) [Windows PowerShell ISE Object Model Reference](Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Object-Model-Reference.md)
trans-unit.target: [The Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](The-Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Scripting-Object-Model.md) [Windows PowerShell ISE Object Model Reference](Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Object-Model-Reference.md)
